title: Lowercase env vars with hyphens are no picked up anymore in Quarkus 3.5.0 (e.g. in docker compose or Hashicorp Nomad)

labels.name: triage/upstream
labels.description: Used for issues which are caused by issues in upstream projects/dependency

body:
### Describe the bug

My app fails to start in docker compose with 3.5.0 because some config keys are not found anymore.

We are not using "proper" uppercase underscore env vars like `MY_VALUE` but `my.value` which has been working fine since Quarkus 1.x in both docker compose (dev envs) and Hashicorp Nomad (integration and prod envs).

While creating the reproducer (see further down) I realized that something like `my.value` does still work (via `@ConfigProperty` or indirectly via `@ConfigMapping`), but something like `my.string-value` doesn't. So it seems to have something to do with hyphens.

### Expected behavior

Config keys should work like in 3.4

### Actual behavior

Config keys with hyphens don't work anymore

### How to Reproduce?

[q_env-lowercase-docker-compose.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/13250263/q_env-lowercase-docker-compose.zip)

1. `mvn clean package -Dquarkus.container-image.build=true`
2. `docker compose up -d`
3. `curl http://localhost:18080/hello` fails, `docker compose logs -f greeting` shows config errors

In contrast, 3.4.3 works fine:
1. `mvn clean package -Dquarkus.container-image.build=true -Dquarkus.platform.version=3.4.3`
2. `docker compose up -d`
3. `curl http://localhost:18080/hello` returns "Hello!"

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

17.0.9

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.5.0

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Maven 3.9.4

### Additional information

I've chatted with @radcortez about this and I was asked to create this issue. The cause most likely lies in SR config.

There is a hint in the migration guide, but only for k8s: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/wiki/Migration-Guide-3.5#kubernetes-environment-variables
